Q1.question:
What is the maximum number of credits that can be transferred to CAS from another institution?
A. 32
B. 48
C. 64
D. 96

Q2.question:
Who determines if a course fulfills a CAS major or minor requirement for a transfer student?
A. Registrar
B. Faculty of the department
C. Dean's Office
D. Admissions

Q3.question:
Transfer students must take how many credits in CAS to earn a degree?
A. 64
B. 96
C. 128
D. 32

Q4.question:
Transfer credit is only awarded for courses with a grade of:
A. C or better
B. D or better
C. B or better
D. Pass

Q5.question:
Which office evaluates external transfer credits for students entering CAS?
A. Registrar
B. Office of Academic Affairs
C. College Advising Center
D. Dean of Faculty

Q6.question:
Students may not receive transfer credit for which of the following types of courses?
A. Online courses from accredited colleges
B. Courses taken more than 10 years ago
C. Summer session courses
D. Liberal arts electives

Q7.question:
How many total credits must a student complete to graduate from CAS?
A. 120
B. 128
C. 130
D. 124

Q8.question:
Courses transferred to CAS are recorded with what transcript notation?
A. The letter grade earned
B. Only the course title and credit
C. GPA and credit
D. Both grade and credit

Q9.question:
Which of the following is required for transfer credits to apply to the major?
A. Course syllabus only
B. Faculty approval
C. Deanâ€™s signature
D. Letter of recommendation

Q10.question:
Advanced standing is limited to how many total credits?
A. 32
B. 64
C. 96
D. 120

Q11.question:
How are external writing credits reviewed for transfer?
A. By the Office of Global Programs
B. Through the Expository Writing Program
C. Via the Department of English
D. Automatically applied

Q12.question:
Transfer students must fulfill which part of the Core Curriculum at NYU?
A. None, all waived
B. All requirements
C. Only foreign language
D. Only science

Q13.question:
Which transfer students must submit a transfer credit reevaluation request after their first term?
A. Students with GPA under 3.0
B. All transfers
C. Students dissatisfied with initial evaluations
D. Those with over 64 credits

Q14.question:
Transfer students must complete how many semesters in residence at CAS to graduate?
A. 2
B. 3
C. 4
D. 5

Q15.question:
Students transferring from other NYU schools must complete how many CAS credits to graduate?
A. 64
B. 32
C. 48
D. 96

Q16.question:
Credit from institutions not accredited by a regional association is:
A. Fully accepted
B. Accepted with conditions
C. Reviewed individually
D. Not accepted

Q17.question:
Can transfer credit be granted for courses taken at institutions not accredited by regional associations?
A. Yes
B. Only with a departmental petition
C. No
D. Depends on department

Q18.question:
How are writing course transfer credits reviewed at NYU CAS?
A. Through Expository Writing Program evaluation
B. By CAS Dean
C. By the Registrar
D. Automatically applied if 3+ credits

Q19.question:
What is the minimum grade for a course to be accepted for transfer?
A. D
B. C
C. B
D. P (Pass)

Q20.question:
Transfer credit is not awarded for which of the following?
A. Liberal arts courses
B. Courses completed over 10 years ago
C. College-level language courses
D. Online courses from accredited institutions
